Element.Name: UBL VersionID
Element.Description: Indicated the version of UBL the message is based on

Element.Name: Customization identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the specification of content and rules that apply to the transaction. Identifying the customization/implementation guide/contextualization of the syntax message and its extension that applies to the credit note transaction, enables the receiver to apply the correct validation to the received document as well as to route the document to an appropriate service for processing.

Element.Name: Profile identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the BII profile or business process context in which the transaction appears. Identifying the profile or business process context in which the transaction appears enables the buyer to direct the message to an appropriate service as well as controlling its relation to other documents exchanged as part of the same process.

Element.Name: Credit note identifier
Element.Description: An credit note instance must contain an identifier. An credit note identifier enables positive referencing the document instance for various purposes including referencing between documents that are part of the same process.

Element.Name: Credit note issue date
Element.Description: The issue date of an credit note is required by EU directives as well as country laws. A credit note must therefore contain the date on which it was issued. Format YYYY-MM-DD.

Element.Name: Tax point date
Element.Description: The date applicable VAT.

Element.Name: Note
Element.Description: The textual note provides the seller a means for providing unstructured information that is relevant to the credit note. This can be notes or other similar information that is not contained explicitly in another qualified element. Information given in as textual notes is mainly intended for manual processing. When “clauses” or “declarations” are used they should be stated in full in the note element.

Element.Name: Currency code
Element.Description: The currency in which the monetary amounts are stated must be stated in the credit note. According to EU Directive a currency code from ISO 4217 must be supplied for all monetary amounts.

Attribute.Description: Identification of the codelist.

Element.Name: VAT currency code
Element.Description: Currency code for VAT in local currency, must be filled if the creditnote currency is not NOK.

Attribute.Description: Identification of the codelist.

Element.Name: Accounting string
Element.Description: The credit note may contain a reference to the buyer's accounting code applied to the credit note as a whole, expressed as text rather than a code in order to facilitate automation in booking into accounts following an order to credit note transformation.

Element.Name: Invoice period
Element.Description: The period which the credit note covers.

Element.Name: Start date
Element.Description: The date on which the period starts. The start dates counts as part of the period. For credit notes that charge for services or items delivered over a time period is necessary to be able to state the start date of the period for which the credit note relates such as for metered services and subscriptions.

Element.Name: End date
Element.Description: The date on which the period ends. The end date counts as part of the period. It must be possible to state the end date of the period for which the credit note relates such as for metered services and subscriptions.

Element.Name: Order reference
Element.Description: An assosiation to an order reference

Element.Name: Order reference
Element.Description: Reference to an order (issued by the buyer) that the credit note relates to.

Element.Name: Billing reference
Element.Description: A reference to the invoice/credit note which is the basis for this creditnote.

Element.Name: Invoice document reference
Element.Description: Invoice identifier

Element.Name: Document identifier
Element.Description: The identifier of the reference document.

Element.Name: Issue date
Element.Description: The date when the reference billing document was issued.

Element.Name: Credit note document reference
Element.Description: Reference to previous credit note.

Element.Name: Document identifier
Element.Description: The identifier of the reference document.

Element.Name: Issue date
Element.Description: The date when the reference billing document was issued.

Element.Name: Contract document reference
Element.Description: Reference to contract or framework agreement.

Element.Name: Identifier
Element.Description: Positive identification of the reference such as a unique identifier. To positively identify relevant contractual issues the credit note may contain an identifier of a contract that applies to the credit note.

Element.Name: Contract type
Element.Description: A credit note may contain the type of contract that is referred to (such as framework agreement) in a coded way to enable automated processing based on the contract type.

Attribute.Description: Must be 'UNCL1001'

Element.Name: Document type
Element.Description: The short description of what is reference such as contract type, document type , meter etc. A credit note may contain the type of contract that is referred to (such as framework agreement).

Element.Name: Additional document reference
Element.Description: Reference to additional documents.

Element.Name: Document identifier
Element.Description: An identifier for the referenced document.

Element.Name: Description
Element.Description: A short description of the document type.

Element.Name: Attachment
Element.Description: Reference to attached document, externally referred to, referred to in the MIME location or embedded.

Element.Name: Embedded binary object
Element.Description: The attached document embeded as binary object. A credit note may contain an attached electronic document as an encoded object in the credit note in order to provide supporting documents such as timesheets, usages reports etc. The seller can only expect the receiver to process attachments according to rule.

Attribute.Description: Type of attachment.

Element.Name: External reference
Element.Description: An attached document

Element.Name: External reference
Element.Description: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that identifies where the external document is located.

Element.Name: Accounting supplier party
Element.Description: Organisation or person responsible som delivering the goods and services.

Element.Name: Party
Element.Description: An association to party.

Element.Name: Electronic address ID
Element.Description: A credit note may contain the sellers electronic address. The address can be of any format and the format should be identified in the message.

Attribute.Description: Identification of the issuing agency of the EndpointID

Element.Name: Party identification
Element.Description: An association to Party Identification

Element.Name: Identifier
Element.Description: A credit note may contain a registered identifier for the seller. Information referenced by the identifier is not considered part of the message (i.e. the buyer is not required to look up the identifier in the relevant registry and process additional information).

Attribute.Description: Identification of the issuing agency of the party identification.

Element.Name: Party name
Element.Description: Name of supplier

Element.Name: Name
Element.Description: A credit note must contain the name of the seller.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number. A credit note must contain the seller’s street name and number or P.O.box.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building. A credit note may contain an additional address line for seller address.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code. A credit note must contain the seller’s city.

Element.Name: Post Code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code. A credit note may contain the seller’s post code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text. In some countries regions or other type of country sub divisions are commonly used. A credit note may contain that information.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: The country where the address is. The country should always be given by using ISO code 3166 alpha 2. The seller’s address country must be contained in a credit note in the form of a two letter code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2).

Attribute.Description: Attribute must be 'ISO3166-1:Alpha2'.

Element.Name: Party tax scheme
Element.Description: Tax scheme for the supplier.

Element.Name: VAT registration number
Element.Description: When the credit note is a VAT credit note it must state the sellers VAT registration number and tax scheme. The supplier's VAT-number (Norwegian MVA number) made out of the organisational number and the letters MVA. Mandatory if the supplier is taxable.

Element.Name: Identifier
Element.Description: Code for TaxScheme. VAT is the only legal value

Element.Name: Party legal entity
Element.Description: Association to Party Legal Entity

Element.Name: Registration name
Element.Description: The name under which the seller is legally registered.

Element.Name: Company ID
Element.Description: A credit note may contain the identifier assigned to the party by the national company registrar. The supplying organisations legal organisation number.

Attribute.Description: Identification of the issuing agency of the company ID.

Element.Description: The legal address of the supplier.
The name of the city where the seller is legally registered.

Element.Name: Country
Element.Description: The country in which the seller is legally registered.

Attribute.Description: Attribute must be 'ISO3166-1:Alpha2'.

Element.Name: Identifier
Element.Description: The supplier's reference specified as "Our ref."

Element.Name: Name
Element.Description: The supplier contact person.

Element.Name: Telephone
Element.Description: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number, this is that number. A credit note may contain a telephone number for a relevant contact at the seller.

Element.Name: Telefax
Element.Description: A fax number for the contact persons. A credit note may contain a tele-fax number for a relevant contact at the seller.

Element.Name: Electronic mail
Element.Description: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email. A credit note may contain a telephone number for a relevant contact at the seller.

Element.Name: Party
Element.Description: An association to party.

Element.Name: Electronic address ID
Element.Description: A credit note may contain the buyers electronic address. The address can be of any format and the format should be identified in the message. Electronic addresses for Norwegian actors using the PEPPOL transport infrastructure shall be specified as Norwegian Organization Number.

Attribute.Description: Identification of the issuing agency of the EndpointID.

Element.Name: Party identification
Element.Description: An association to Party Identification

Element.Name: Customer identifier
Element.Description: A credit note may contain a registered identifier for the seller. Information referenced by the identifier is not considered part of the message (i.e. the buyer is not required to look up the identifier in the relevant registry and process additional information).

Attribute.Description: Identification of the issuing agency of the party identification.

Element.Name: Party name
Element.Description: Name of customer.

Element.Name: Name
Element.Description: A credit note must contain the name of the buyer.

Element.Name: Postal address
Element.Description: The address of the customer.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number. A credit note must contain the seller’s street name and number or P.O.box.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building. A credit note may contain an additional address line for seller address.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code. A credit note must contain the seller’s city.

Element.Name: Post Code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code. A credit note may contain the seller’s post code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text. In some countries regions or other type of country sub divisions are commonly used. A credit note may contain that information.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: The country where the address is. The country should always be given by using ISO code 3166 alpha 2. The seller’s address country must be contained in a credit note in the form of a two letter code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2).

Attribute.Description: Attribute must be 'ISO3166-1:Alpha2'.

Element.Name: Party tax scheme
Element.Description: Tax scheme of the customer.

Element.Name: VAT registration number
Element.Description: A credit note may contain the buyers VAT identifier In order to facilitate reverse charge and intra community supply billing. The customers VAT-number (Norwegian MVA number) made out of the organisational number and the letters MVA

Attribute.Description: The attribute must be «NO:VAT"

Element.Name: Identifier
Element.Description: Code for TaxScheme. VAT is the only legal value

Element.Name: Party legal entity
Element.Description: Association to Party Legal Entity. Must not be filled if the customer is a consumer (B2C), else mandatory.

Element.Name: Legal name
Element.Description: The legal name of the customer

Element.Name: Company ID
Element.Description: A credit note may contain the identifier assigned to the Party by the national company registrar. The organisation number. Only numbers are valid. Must not be used if B2C credit note (consumers).

Attribute.Description: Identification of the issuing agency of the company ID.

Element.Name: Contact
Element.Description: The customers contact person.

Element.Name: Identifier
Element.Description: Name or identifier specifying the customers reference (Eg employee number)

Element.Name: Name
Element.Description: The name of the contact person. A credit note may contain a person name for a relevant contact at the buyer.

Element.Name: Telephone
Element.Description: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number, this is that number. A credit note may contain a telephone number for a relevant contact at the buyer.

Element.Name: Telefax
Element.Description: A fax number for the contact persons. A credit note may contain a tele-fax number for a relevant contact at the buyer.

Element.Name: Electronic mail
Element.Description: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email. A credit note may contain a telephone number for a relevant contact at the buyer.

Element.Name: Payee Party
Element.Description: An association to the Payee.

Element.Name: Party identification
Element.Description: Identification of the Payee.

Element.Name: Payee identifier
Element.Description: Used in absence of or in addition to the payee party name. Use and identifier known to the document recipient.

Attribute.Description: Identification of the issuing agency of the party identification.

Element.Name: Party name
Element.Description: The name of the payee.

Element.Name: Name
Element.Description: The name of the payee party.

Element.Name: Party legal entity
Element.Description: Association to Party Legal Entity.

Element.Name: Company ID
Element.Description: An credit note may contain the identifier assigned to the payee by the national company registrar. The organisation number.

Attribute.Description: Identification of the issuing agency of the company ID.

Element.Name: Tax representative party
Element.Description: Information regarding the tax representative of the supplier.

Element.Name: Party name
Element.Description: The name of the tax representative.

Element.Name: Name
Element.Description: The name of the tax representative party.

Element.Name: Party tax scheme
Element.Description: Tax scheme for the representative.

Element.Name: VAT registration ID
Element.Description: The tax representative party's VAT registration ID. Organization number plus the letters MVA.

Attribute.Description: The attribute must be "NO:VAT".

Element.Name: Identifier
Element.Description: Code for TaxScheme. VAT is the only legal value.

Element.Name: Delivery
Element.Description: Delivery details

Element.Name: Delivery date
Element.Description: The actual delivery date for the invoice goods/services

Element.Name: Delivery location
Element.Description: Specification of where the goods or services were delivered.

Element.Name: Delivery identifier
Element.Description: A unique identifier (eg a GLN number) of where the goods is delivered.

Attribute.Description: Identification of the issuing agency of the location identifier

Element.Name: Address
Element.Description: Delivery address.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post Code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: The country where the address is. The country should always be given by using ISO code 3166 alpha 2.

Attribute.Description: Attribute must be 'ISO3166-1:Alpha2'

Element.Name: Payment means
Element.Description: Details regarding how payments will be made

Element.Name: Payment means code
Element.Description: An invoice may contain an indication about how the payment should be handled. Code according to UN/CEFACT codelist 4461.
Element.Value: CEFACT codelist 4461 is used - ListID = UN/ECE 4461. 31=debit transfer.

Element.Name: Due date
Element.Description: Latest date on which funds should have reached the account receivable.

Element.Name: Payment channel code
Element.Description: Code for paymentchannel, IBAN, BBAN.

Element.Name: Payment ID
Element.Description: In Norway: KID number (customer identification number).

Element.Name: Payee financial account
Element.Description: Information regarding the payee's financial account.

Element.Name: Financial account ID
Element.Description: The identifier for the account. Depending on circumstances the identifier can be in local format or standardized format such as IBAN.

Attribute.Description: Identification of type of account.

Element.Name: Financial institution branch
Element.Description: The branch or department of the financial institution.

Element.Name: ID
Element.Description: The identifier for a branch or division of an organization may, in some countries, be used to positively identify the location of he account or supplement the financial institution identifier.

Element.Name: Financial institution
Element.Description: The identifier of the financial institution (BIC).

Element.Name: Institution ID
Element.Description: An identifier for the financial institution where the account is located, such as the BIC identifier (SWIFT code).

Attribute.Description: Must be 'BIC' if account identifier is IBAN.

Element.Name: Name
Element.Description: Name of the finance institution.

Element.Name: Address
Element.Description: The address of the financial institution

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post Code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: The country where the address is. The country should always be given by using ISO code 3166 alpha 2.

Element.Name: Payment terms
Element.Description: Description of payment terms.

Element.Name: Note
Element.Description: Payment terms text.

Element.Name: Tax exchange rate
Element.Description: Exchange rate for calculation of tax in home currency, mandatory if DocumentCurrencyCode is not = NOK.

Element.Name: Source currency code
Element.Description: The currency code for the from currency.

Attribute.Description: Identification of the codelist.

Element.Name: Target currency
Element.Description: The currency code for the to currency.

Attribute.Description: Identification of the codelist.

Element.Name: Exchange rate
Element.Description: The exchange rate.

Element.Name: Mathematic operator code
Element.Description: Mathematic operator code to use to calculate tax amount. Fixed: Multiply.

Element.Name: Date
Element.Description: The date for the calculation rate.

Element.Name: Allowance Charge
Element.Description: Description of allowances and charges on document level.

Element.Name: Allowance/Charge indicator
Element.Description: True = Charge, False = Allowance.

Element.Name: Reason code
Element.Description: A coded specification of what the allowance or charge is. A credit note may contain a coded description of what is being added or deducted. E.g. „volume discount" or "packing charges", for each allowance or charge. Use codelist AllowanceChargeReasonCode, UN/ECE 4465, Version D08B.

Attribute.Description: Must be 'UNCL4465'

Element.Name: Reason
Element.Description: A textual reason for the allowance or the charge. Can also be its name. One textual description of what is being added or deducted. E.g. „volume discount" or "packing charges" must be stated for each allowance and charge on document level in a credit note.

Element.Name: Amount
Element.Description: The net amount of the allowance or the charge. For each allowance or charge a credit note must contain the amount. Allowances are subtracted from the total credit note amount and charges are added to the amount. The amount is “net” without VAT.

Attribute.Description: MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217.

Element.Name: Tax category
Element.Description: Specification of tax categories.

Element.Name: VAT category
Element.Description: A code that identifies to what VAT subcategory the allowance or charge belongs to. A credit note may contain information about one VAT category for each allowances and Charges on document level.

Attribute.Description: Must be 'UNCL5305'.

Element.Name: Percent
Element.Description: The VAT percentage rate that applies to the allowance/charge.

Element.Name: Tax scheme
Element.Description: An association to tax scheme (VAT).

Element.Name: Identifier
Element.Description: Code for TaxScheme. VAT is the only legal value.

Element.Name: Tax total
Element.Description: Specification of tax total and tax per tax category.

Element.Name: Total VAT amount
Element.Description: The total VAT amount that is "added to the document total w/o VAT". This is the sum of all VAT subcategory amounts. A credit note may contain the total VAT amount. This amount is the sum of each sub total for each VAT rate.

Attribute.Description: MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217.

Element.Name: Tax subtotal
Element.Description: Specification of tax subtotals.

Element.Name: Taxable amount
Element.Description: The amount that is the base for the VAT rate applied in the subcategory. For each VAT category a credit note must contain the amount to which VAT percent (rate) is applied to calculate the VAT sub total amount for that category.

Attribute.Description: MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217.

Element.Name: Tax amount
Element.Description: The calculated amount of the tax derived by multiplying the taxable amount with the tax percentage. For each VAT category a credit note must contain the amount of VAT for that category.

Attribute.Description: MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217.

Element.Name: VAT amount in local currency
Element.Description: A credit note may, in cases when credit note are issued in currencies other than the national currency for VAT reporting, contain the VAT amount in the local currency.

Attribute.Description: MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217.

Element.Name: Tax category
Element.Description: Identification of tax category.

Element.Name: Identifier
Element.Description: A code that uniquelly identifies each subtotal within the transaction. Each VAT category a credit note must be identified with a code.

Attribute.Description: Must be 'UNCL5305'.

Element.Name: Percent
Element.Description: The tax rate that is to be applied to the taxable amount in order to derive the tax amount. For each VAT category a credit note must contain the VAT percentage for each sub total taxable amount so that it can be used to calculate the VAT amount. Where VAT category code is stated then VAT category percentage must also be stated.

Element.Name: VAT exemption
Element.Description: A textual description of the reason why the items belongin to the subtotal are exempted for VAT. A credit note may contain, as text, the reasons for why a value amount in a category is exempted from VAT. credit note only support one category with an exemption reason pr. credit note. Mandatory if VAT category = E.

Element.Name: Tax scheme
Element.Description: An association to tax scheme (VAT).

Element.Name: Identifier
Element.Description: Code for TaxScheme. VAT is the only legal value.

Element.Name: Legal monetary total
Element.Description: Specifications of monetary totals.

Element.Name: Line extension amount
Element.Description: Sum of line amounts in the document. A credit note must contain the sum of all line amounts. The amount must be exclusive of VAT but inclusive of allowances or charges applied to the lines as well as taxes, other than VAT.

Attribute.Description: MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217.

Element.Name: Tax exclusive amount
Element.Description: The "Sum of line amounts" plus "sum of allowances on document level" plus "sum of charges on document level". A credit note must contain the total amount of the credit note, including document level allowances and charges but exclusive of VAT.

Attribute.Description: MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217.

Element.Name: Tax inclusive amount
Element.Description: The total value including VAT A credit note must contain the total amount of the credit note inclusive VAT. I.e. the total value of the purchase irrespective of payment status.

Attribute.Description: MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217.

Element.Name: Allowance total amount
Element.Description: Sum of all allowances on header level in the document. Allowances on line level are included in the line amount and summed up into the "sum of line amounts" A credit note may contain the total amount of all allowances given on document level. Line allowances are included in the net line amount.

Attribute.Description: MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217.

Element.Name: Charge total amount
Element.Description: Sum of all charge on header level in the document. Charges on line level are included in the line amount and summed up into the "sum of line amounts" A credit note may contain the total amount of all charges given on document level. Line charges are included in the net line amount.

Attribute.Description: MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217.

Element.Name: Prepaid amount
Element.Description: Any amounts that have been paid a-priory. A credit note may contain the sum of all prepaid amounts that must be deducted from the payment of this credit note. For fully paid credit note (cash or card) this amount equals the credit note total.

Attribute.Description: MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217.

Element.Name: Payable rounding amount
Element.Description: Any rounding of the "Document total including VAT" A credit note may contain the rounding amount (positive or negative) added to the credit note to produce a rounded credit note total.

Attribute.Description: MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217.

Element.Name: Payable amount
Element.Description: The amount that is expected to be paid based on the document. This amount is the "Document total including VAT" less the "paid amounts" that have been paid apriori. A credit note must contain the total amount to be paid that is due. If the credit note is fully paid i.e. cash or card, the due amount for the credit note is zero.

Attribute.Description: MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217.

Element.Name: Credit note line
Element.Description: An association to one or more creditnote lines.

Element.Name: Line identifier
Element.Description: Each line in a credit note must contain an identifier that is unique within the document to make it possible to reference the line. For example, from other documents like credit notes and in disputes.

Element.Name: Note
Element.Description: Each line in a credit notee may contain a free-form text. This element may contain notes or any other similar information that is not contained explicitly in another structure. Clauses or declarations that refer to a particular line should be entered in full as notes.

Element.Name: Credited quantity
Element.Description: Each line in a credit note must contain the credited quantity. The quantity may be negative in cases when the credit note is used to reverse an invoice line that was negative.

Attribute.Name: Unit
Attribute.Description: Each line in a credit note must contain the unit of measure that applies to the credited quantity. Unit of Measure. Code based on UN/ECE rec 20 , - versjon 6e 2009.
Must be 'UNECERec20'.

Element.Name: Line amount
Element.Description: Each line in a credit note must contain the total amount of the line. The amount is “net” without VAT, i.e. inclusive of line level allowances and charges as well as relevant taxes, except VAT which must be excluded from the amount.

Attribute.Description: MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217.

Element.Name: Accounting cost
Element.Description: The credit note may contain a reference to the buyer's accounting code applicable to the specific line, expressed as text rather than a code in order to facilitate automation in booking into accounts following an order to credit note transformation.

Element.Name: Invoice period
Element.Description: The period the creditnote line cover.

Element.Name: Start date
Element.Description: The date on which the period starts. The start dates counts as part of the period.

Element.Name: End date
Element.Description: The date on which the period ends. The end date counts as part of the period.

Element.Name: Order line reference
Element.Description: Refers to a single order line.

Element.Name: Order line reference
Element.Description: Each line in a credit note may contain a reference to the relevant order line in the order that is identified on the document level in the credit note. If the creditnote contains several orders, the order reference is given at the line level only. The order reference at line level must refer to both the order and the actual orderline. The syntax for specifying this should be agreed between the parties. Recommendation: Ordernumber##Order line number

Element.Name: Billing reference
Element.Description: Reference to the invoice/creditnote.

Element.Name: Invoice document reference
Element.Description: Reference to the invoice which is the basis for this invoice line.

Element.Name: Invoice document reference
Element.Description: The identifier of the referenced invoice document.

Element.Name: Credit note document reference
Element.Description: Reference to the credit note which this credit note is based upon.

Element.Name: Credit note document reference
Element.Description: The identifier of the referenced credit note document.

Element.Name: Billing reference line
Element.Description: Reference to the invoice line.

Element.Name: Invoice line reference
Element.Description: Each line in credit note may contain a reference to the relevant invoice line in the original invoice that is being credited.

Element.Name: Delivery
Element.Description: Delivery details.

Element.Name: Delivery date
Element.Description: The actual delivery date for the invoice goods/services.

Element.Name: Delivery location
Element.Description: Information regarding the delivery location.

Element.Name: Delivery identifier
Element.Description: A unique identifier (eg a GLN number) of where the goods is delivered.

Attribute.Description: Identification of the issuing agency of the location identifier.

Element.Name: Address
Element.Description: Delivery address

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number. A credit note must contain the seller’s street name and number or P.O.box.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building. A credit note may contain an additional address line for seller address.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code. A credit note must contain the seller’s city.

Element.Name: Post Code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code. A credit note may contain the seller’s post code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text. In some countries regions or other type of country sub divisions are commonly used. A credit note may contain that information.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: The country where the address is. The country should always be given by using ISO code 3166 alpha 2. The seller’s address country must be contained in a credit note in the form of a two letter code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2).

Attribute.Description: Attribute must be 'ISO3166-1:Alpha2'.

Element.Name: Amount
Element.Description: The VAT amount for the credit note line. Calculated as a multiple of line amount and line VAT rate. The VAT amount on line should only be used informatively (i.e. not used as part validating the credit note calculation of amounts) when required by national legislation.

Attribute.Description: MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217.

Element.Name: Allowance charge
Element.Description: Allowances and charges related to line level.

Element.Name: Allowance/Charge indicator.
Element.Description: True = Charge, False = Allowance

Element.Name: Reason
Element.Description: A textual reason for the allowance or the charge. Can also be its name.

Element.Name: Amount
Element.Description: The net amount of the allowance or the charge excluding VAT..

Attribute.Description: MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217

Element.Name: Item
Element.Description: Information regarding the goods or services.

Element.Name: Item description
Element.Description: Description of the goods/services.

Element.Name: Name
Element.Description: A short name for an item. Each line in a credit note must contain the name of the credited item.

Element.Name: Seller item identification
Element.Description: The seller item number.

Element.Name: Sellers identifier
Element.Description: The sellers identifier for the item. Each line in a credit note may contain the seller’s identifier for an item.

Element.Name: Standard item identification
Element.Description: Identifies the product/service according to a standard system.

Element.Name: Identifier
Element.Description: A item identifier based on a registered schema. Each line in a credit note may contain a registered item identifier.

Attribute.Description: Must be provided if the element is used.

Element.Name: Origin country
Element.Description: Country code for the origin country of the goods.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: Each line in a credit note may contain the items country of origin. When relevant this allows the buyer to identify whether further customs procedures are required.

Element.Name: Commodity classification
Element.Description: Specification of commodity classification

Element.Name: Classification code
Element.Description: The items CPV code.

Attribute.Description: Must be present if the element is used

Element.Name: Classified tax category
Element.Description: Specifies the tax category for the goods/services.

Element.Name: Identifier
Element.Description: Each line in a credit note may contain the VAT category/rate used for this credit note line. The category code acts as a key for summing up line amounts pr. VAT category as well for relating the VAT category percentage given on document level, to the line. If the credit note is a VAT credit note each line must contain a category code.

Element.Name: Percentage
Element.Description: The VAT percentage rate that applies to the credit note line as whole.

Element.Name: Tax scheme
Element.Description: Tax scheme specification.

Element.Name: Identifier
Element.Description: Code for TaxScheme. VAT is the only legal value.

Element.Name: Additional item property
Element.Description: Specify additional item properties

Element.Name: Property name
Element.Description: The name of the property. The name must be sufficiently descriptive to define the value. The definition may be supplemented with the property unit of measure when relevant. E.g. Size, Color, Year.

Element.Name: Property value
Element.Description: The value of the item property. E.g. XXL, Blue, 2007.

Element.Name: Party name
Element.Description: Name of manufacturer

Element.Name: Name
Element.Description: Name of manufacturer.

Element.Name: Party legal entity
Element.Description: The manufacturer's legal entity.

Element.Name: Company ID
Element.Description: The legal company ID of the manufacturer.

Attribute.Description: Identification of the issuing agency of the company ID.

Element.Name: Price
Element.Description: Price information.

Element.Name: Price
Element.Description: Each line in a credit note may contain the net price of the item including all allowances or charges that directly relates to price (e.g. discount), and taxes but excluding VAT. The net price of an item including discounts or surcharges that apply to the price.

Attribute.Description: MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217.

Element.Name: Base quantity
Element.Description: The number of credit note quantity units for which the price is stated. E.g. credited quantity is 1000 LTR, price is €15 pr. 10 LTR. Price base quantity must be given in the same unit of measure as the credited quantity.

Element.Name: Allowance Charge
Element.Description: Allowance and charge related to price

Element.Name: Allowance/Charge indicator
Element.Description: True = Charge, False = Allowance.

Element.Name: Reason
Element.Description: Description of the allowance/charge.

Element.Name: Multiplier
Element.Description: Allowance or charge percentage.

Element.Name: Amount
Element.Description: The total discount subtracted from the gross price to reach the net price. Each line in a credit note may contain the amount of the price discount. The price discount amount is informative.

Attribute.Description: MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217.

Element.Name: List price
Element.Description: The gross price of the item before subtracting discounts. E.g. list price. Each line in a credit note may contain the gross price, e.g. List price for the item.
